reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very fun and addictive game. I must have started about a dozen times now, always finding better way to develop and progress ... or computer crashing in the heat of the action (probably also high outside temperatures helped. This actually brings me to one thing I am really missing: SAVE. Please give us save functionality. Occasionally, on Windows crash the game did no longer recognise the survival scenario of the active game  and thus I ended up butt naked in the wild.

The hardest part for me in getting started with this game was figuring out how to EAT!! I think I starved to death twice before I had the epiphany of putting food into the direct access key panel. Slow learner, I know.

The mechanics are great with having to create parts before being able to create machinery. Building a base is an interesting experience and each subsequent attempt made them look tidier.

There is another thing that would help enjoying the game more: The light of the drill should be less focussed. Since mining takes up quite some time, one usually does that to a good extent at night and trying to find one's way around the bore hole is somewhat awkward.

Anyway, great game and I am glad I bought it. It is good fun and worth every penny spent on it. In fact, over time this could become a game that is really cheap in regards to replay value! Great job.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't usually review alphas/early access because they aren't usually good enough to do a review for.

That being said, this one is. With any sandbox game, it has its limitations because you can sometimes run out of inspiration/new things to find/craft. However, despite being very early access, the graphics are good, the movement/shooting is decent, and the ship building/base building is fun and intuitive. Even the music is great, and that's not something you usually find in an early access game.

On the whole, it's got relatively few glitches even though it's early access. I definitely recommend this if you want a block-style space exploration game, and just remember to be patient as the developers come up with new content and make new changes and improvements (which they have already done quite a lot in the time I've had the game). Good work Eleon on this game! Looking forward to much more fun in the future!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a survival exploration game. It has the basic building style of Space engineers, with the exploration of Starbound. I will try to write a review that would help answer the real questions i would want to know before buying this game. Feel free to skip to the section that applys.

(Pre-Alpha? How are the dev's? Should i get this now?)
The devolpers say it's in Pre-Alpha.... It's not. Having expierence as a game designer and programer, i would say this game should be labeled Early Beta, or late Alpha. It's completely playable, despite lacking a few futures. I think this alone speaks volumes of the devolpers. They are not following the typical steam route of taking money for a piece of crap in hopes that it will be completed. The devolpers are designing the game for the community, as they have several polls on what new futures, or what we want them to work on next. There was a poll recently, which the community choose procedural (random generated) planets. It's been about 2-3 weeks and within the next few days we will have procedural planets.

It's worth getting now IMHO as you can build a base, a giant starship, a regular spaceship and a ground vehicle (there really isn't much reason to build the ground vehicle over the regular spaceship atm as content is lacking on that). Survival is playable now, and you can travel to 3 planets. When procedual planets come out, it will feel like the game is nearly complete to most of us who have played these type of games before. The difference is that the dev's have a ton of features planed for the final game, and the dev's do not considered it to be in beta until most or all of the features are in the game. Make no mistake, the dev's here are good. The are active in the community, have nearly weekly updates and release major new content ever month or so. They arn't just some of the best dev's on steam, they gotta be in the top 3 for indie (top 10 for non indie).

TLDR: Dev's directly ask and implament community idea's, and it's feels way far more complete then the suposed Pre-Alpha" state. It's worth the money

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I will make this short and sweet. Though it may look simplistic graphically, the gameplay is excellently adictive. If you, like my self, have ever desired a more realistic minecraft, set in space, In which you can fly from planet to space and back again, build bases, fighters and capital ships. This is for you.

For a product that is still in development I am astounded at the depth of this game, and has had me exploring, hunting, scavenging, and building for the better part of 4 days. I have barely scratched the surface of all that is available, and am positively thrilled to see what the future holds for this game.

Cheers to the developers!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nYes it's early access. However, if you like games like ARK. . . and sci-fi/space ships are more your thing, you should really look at supporting this game even in it's early state. There is a lot of content here already and it is very playable. I am really excited to see where this game goes. The ability to build space ships, enter space, and go to other planets and stations is just amazing to me. The planets are actual spheres and if someone else is on a different part of the planet, the night cycle is realistic to their position on the sphere. i thought that was really cool. The devs have put a lot of thought and care into this game so far, and it shows. A lot of times I find crafting systems confusing and frustrating. This game has a deep crafting system, but the information on how to build something is readily available. The game seems to run fine on my machine and they have implemented dedicated servers which is a plus in my book.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a great game.
Let me start out by saying that prior to owning this, I already had sunk a decent amount of time into Space Engineers. And while Space Engineers is a better looking game with better building mechanics, it really struggles to make survival fun. I usually just play it for the creative mode. That's where Empyrion comes in. Empyrion can in no way, at least currently, compete with SE's complex building system. However, Empyrion is still a very young game, compared to SE's 2 or so years of existence, so it deserves a bit of a pass there.
So you're now probably wondering, why did I purchase Empyrion if I already owned and enjoyed Space Engineers? Well, I was looking for a fun space survival game, not just a sandbox. And boy, did I find it.
First of all, Empyrion's survival system is, at least currently, MUCH simpler than Space Engineer's, despite adding a food bar into the mix. How is this possible? First of all getting what you need to make stuff isn't terribly tedious. In fact, I'd say it's more akin to Minecraft in terms of balance. Just right. Ore spots are spaced out, but most have more ore in them than any one person could ever need or even want. And while getting around on foot can be kinda... slow, you start the game with a sizeable amount of ore in your escape pod, meaning that making your first SV or HV will be pretty easy, even after making a base. Once you have a working SV or HV, getting to those ore spots becomes a breeze. As for food, you'll start out hunting things for meat to turn into steaks or salami, but eventually start growing your own food, and never have to hunt again. And in terms of oxygen, you literally just make a machine, stick it in water, fill it with fuel, and forget about it. It makes oxygen while you do other stuff, so no worries!
As for what really makes this an excellent survival game, I'd have to say the goals". And by goals
date: I mean attacking alien bases scattered all over the solar system. There are many different types of these bases
hoursPlayed: others incredibly difficult. Unlike Space Engineers
voteText: these bases have actual alien troops in them
helpfulPercent: with guns and everything
votesHelpful: who will kill you on sight. And they HURT. Suddenly
votesTotal: something that seemed so trivial before becomes something you have to carefully plan out to execute. And a lot more fun.\nAs for the negatives of this game
votesFunny: I'd have to say that currently there are a lot of bugs. Not game-breaking bugs
commentsCount: but bugs nontheless. Additionally
column16: the graphics look like theyre from ancient times with modern lighting. A bit strange if you ask me
column17: but hopefully this may improve with time. If not
column18: I still don't care
column19: the game is a lot of fun! Finally
column20: the current explorable system is rather small
column21: and there's not a ton of variation on the different planets. They're generally the same across the map. I do hope that this too will change with time
column22: and it probably will.\nBut overall
column23: I really like this game. If you own Space Engineers
column24: get this anyways. It's not as good as SE in terms of what you can build
column25: but it's definitely a more satisfying survival experience. Buy it!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are a fan of Terraria, this game is for you. It's basically a more complicated version but still pretty great for it being in early alpha. The worst thing I have currently experienced so far though is the music in game. It just feels too plain/boring in my opinon while the title music is pretty damn cool.

The starter guide they give you (the question mark when opening all menu tabs in game) is exactly what you need for first time players. Without that thing I probably would be dying from no oxygen or food trying to figure out what to do to make my stuff.

A smaller problem I had was dying to open wounds and poison because I had no resources yet to make items to cure this stuff and THEY NEVER WEAR OFF!!!! So you are forced to die at beginning if you end up getting hit by enemies but at least you respawn near the stuff you dropped.

You may have a hard complicated time at the beginning but it soon becomes a freaking amazing game once you get on your feet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Thought I'd try this during the free weekend and was surprised. Despite being alpha and needing a lot of work yet, this is a lot of fun. I found it enjoyable and since it was also on sale, I've decided to buy it and contribute towards the future development. This game has a large amount of potential just waiting to be filled.

The beginning was a little frustrating until you learned to read the details of the tutorial missions in the PDA. Then things got much better. You also need to realize you have to right-click with a building component selected on your hotbar to find other shape possibilities. That REALLY needs to be made clearer. Also, for those complainging about having so much to carry around after emptying your escape pod, just put it all in your constructor after you place it. It has plenty of room.

I really love the blueprint system. I've found some great BPs of ships and buildings made by others that look great. I'm especallly impressed with the guy that made the city-ship Atlantis from Stargate. It is classified as a capital ship and is pretty large. Building that will be a very long term goal. LoL

Most have to understand this is an unfinished game and so it still needs work and polish. It can still be a lot of fun but expect quirks and bugs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What star forge promised to be..

This game proved star forge could of, but bailed for a simple project on a single planet. This game offers alot of enjoyment for both survivalist & sci fi fans. But also, fans of guns of icarus will also really enjoy the capital ship battles.

The game even without the AI and life, has much to offer. From creative, to survival, you can live in the stars. You can run you're own servers, play coop or MP alone or with friends for FREE once you own this game.

Do not listen to the short 10 hour reviews as it is not even close to enough time to experience this game.

For alpha, it performs wonders. Even if we compare it to big contendors such as rust, planet explorers or space engineers.

For a full experience of the game, it's best to test the performance and test the game for yourself as it is alpha and may be different for everyone, however, the game is beautiful to play even on intel core processors.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very intreging game to play. The initial start is kind of rough, though the in depth tutorial (which I feel is a bit OP) goes through everything from making basic items to building vehicals and ships.

Not for everyone, this game starts you out with basic survival resources that do not last very long. I recommend playing first a 'scratch' game to get the feel of how this game works, follow the tutorials to their letter when they pop up and don't do much else beside gathering needed resources when needed.

Once you complete all the lessons/quests/tutorial THEN restart the game with a fresh start and go at it full force with a good understanding of the game. It is fairly easy to master and get use to while in solo mode. I have not played multiplayer yet.

For the $10 purchase while on sale, I feel it is well worth the purchase. I have gotten my money worth from the free weekend already and feel I will get more than $10 of play time into this game from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, I decided to try this game out when one of my friends recommended it to me, I am a big fan of Space Engineers and really any kind of survival based games so I decided to try it out as it was on sale for around 10$.  When my friends and I first got into the world I felt a feeling of regret as the game did not look very well, but it didnt stop me from trying it out.  After I learned the basics, I got hooked.  Played for nearly 13 hours the first day and had a blast.  The next day I broke my record and played nearly 15 hours,  even in pre-alpha this game has so much to do and I am very excited for the upcoming updates.  This is by far one of the best games I have ever played, though there are some glitches/problems

1. Not being able to leave a planet without having every player inside of the ship (Though they are going to change this)

2. After leaving space, into a planet.  Your character still acts like he is in space and you can basically fly anywhere you want (Though can be easily fixed by toggling the jetpack key)

3. After leaving and joining back into a server near an Alien base, It will shoot at you even if you are not in range (This happened to one of my friends,  when he joined back his ship was being shot at by nothing)

4. Randomly falling through the map,  while I have not had this happen to me,  it is a common glitch for my friends when they're connected to my server (Though you can just disconnect and reconnect to fix it)

While I'm sure there are many more bugs,  these are the only ones I found/noticed throughout my 32.5 hours of playing.

I would rate this game a 8/10,  probably one of my top 5 games.

If you're looking for a game that looks beautiful, this is not the game for you.  But if you are looking for one that will keep you entertained for hundreds of hours,  then I would definitely recommend it.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I played a few hours over the free weekend. I don't know about the endgame content because I didn't get there, however, The early game is fun and you can tell the developers have put time into the crafting system and the building system.

If you want to build an item but you don't have the required parts you can que up the parts you need and then que the Main thing you wanted to build after it and it will build in order, which is simple and awesome. Having the ability  to build a plane of blocks with a click of a button instead of individually placing each of those 1,000+ blocks is a HUGE timesaver.

I would definitely recommend this game to survival enthusiasts when it's on sale. I also feel a large amount of people will find the game worth the $17.99.

Cons:

1. You can fly from the planet into outer space with no cutscene, however, you do suddenly get teleported into outer space, there is a very obvious change in the backdrop that kills the immersion.

2. The game runs fairly well on my pc. I have a GTX 970 and a i7 920 @ 2.67 ghz. I believe if I overclocked my cpu the game would run much smoother.

3. Depending on the server and other player's connection to the server, you will frop frames. I normally have around 30-60fps and when I joined different servers, with only one person remotely near me, I dropped to below 15fps.

4. You cannot explore the entire planet, while being quite large, there are playable zones that you cannot walk/fly past.

Even with all of the cons this game is still very enjoyable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Firstly the game already has the basics like planets,items and NPCs BUT it needs a lot of polishing. For a start the engine, Unity 5 engine may be good in some cases but not in most, the game sometimes lag spikes in alien strongholds or dungeons and it's really hard to aim when the game constantly lag spikes, so Unreal Engine may get the job done (or maybe not). The NPCs sometimes glitch in a wall or attack you from several metters away from you. Next is the orange dome wall at the top and bottom of a planet, wouldn't say it's that big of a deal but it'll be good to be removed.

I really like the game,have been playing it since the free weekend last friday and I enjoy it very much. I'm looking forward for more new content and best of luck to the dev team.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has so MUCH potential!
For the beginners, learning curve in this game is very steep!
But when you learn how to build your own space vessel, the game becomes extremely addictive.
Building and crafting are highlights of this game.
Exploring planets to find resources and bases is very good.

Since the game just became alpha, I won't talk about the combat.
Monster AI is very basic (melee monsters only walk towards you to attack. Some ranged monster can only shoot X axis and they don't climb or jump over obstacles)
Each weapons need more characteristics (Assault rifle and other rifles feels very identical in causing damage.)

I can't wait to see the game's features fully implemented in the future!

Early Access Review

I'm giving it positive review because for now it already looks pretty great. If you are looking for specific information, depeds what you expect from this game. As for now:

Survival - it is there but a little easy and lacks content.
Spaceship building - pretty neat, compared to Space Engineers for example it has way more nice looking stuff, but doesn't have moving parts like rotors etc.
Exploration and fighting - weapons and spaceships feel really good. But AI is just plain stupid for now. And I was really scared when I was walking through Abandoned mine.

Generally I would recommend to wait few more months so they can add more content. But it looks promising.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Played through this over the free weekend. Definitely recommend it, but it is seriously lacking in any proper tutorial sense. The online guides are still very new, but they help somewhat. A few of the guides tell you the first few steps after arriving on a planet.

Suffice it to say, many people will play this game in build/craft mode even though the survival mode has massive potential for interactions and intelligent playthroughs. It seems to be a great game from what I played and what I have seen content and mechanics, etc.

The only major problem I had was that it kept crashing my computer. I am playing on a computer that is a few years old, but I play many other games on it without issue, including some more particle heavy ones that are both new and very old. So, it bothered me that this particular game had a crashing issue, but the gameplay and such are excellent. Lots of potential. 8/10 would recommend for anyone who likes craft, survival, or exploration games (especially space-themed ones).

For the first 10 hours of free play I fully intended on giving this a thumbs down...  The mechanics are clunky.  The learning curve is steep with little to no ingame direction.  Things as simple as building your initial base taking hours, just because direction is so vague like hitting Y to turn on your base's power or the use of RMB in tooltips.  I spent at least 6 hours and banging my head against the wall to figure out how to even place thrusters correctly on my hover/ship.  Once I slowly and painstakingly figured out different controls mostly by sheer accident or trial and error then I have an oooooh" moment.

I have to assume the "quest" system is currently broken
date: as I got to the build o2 and food production and no matter what I built the check box was never satisfied.\n\nNo joke with "survival"...  The drone base attacks sucked but were manageable

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What star forge promised to be..

This game proved star forge could of, but bailed for a simple project on a single planet. This game offers alot of enjoyment for both survivalist & sci fi fans. But also, fans of guns of icarus will also really enjoy the capital ship battles.

The game even without the AI and life, has much to offer. From creative, to survival, you can live in the stars. You can run you're own servers, play coop or MP alone or with friends for FREE once you own this game.

Do not listen to the short 10 hour reviews as it is not even close to enough time to experience this game.

For alpha, it performs wonders. Even if we compare it to big contendors such as rust, planet explorers or space engineers.

For a full experience of the game, it's best to test the performance and test the game for yourself as it is alpha and may be different for everyone, however, the game is beautiful to play even on intel core processors.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Thought I'd try this during the free weekend and was surprised. Despite being alpha and needing a lot of work yet, this is a lot of fun. I found it enjoyable and since it was also on sale, I've decided to buy it and contribute towards the future development. This game has a large amount of potential just waiting to be filled.

The beginning was a little frustrating until you learned to read the details of the tutorial missions in the PDA. Then things got much better. You also need to realize you have to right-click with a building component selected on your hotbar to find other shape possibilities. That REALLY needs to be made clearer. Also, for those complainging about having so much to carry around after emptying your escape pod, just put it all in your constructor after you place it. It has plenty of room.

I really love the blueprint system. I've found some great BPs of ships and buildings made by others that look great. I'm especallly impressed with the guy that made the city-ship Atlantis from Stargate. It is classified as a capital ship and is pretty large. Building that will be a very long term goal. LoL

Most have to understand this is an unfinished game and so it still needs work and polish. It can still be a lot of fun but expect quirks and bugs.

If you are a fan of Terraria, this game is for you. It's basically a more complicated version but still pretty great for it being in early alpha. The worst thing I have currently experienced so far though is the music in game. It just feels too plain/boring in my opinon while the title music is pretty damn cool.

The starter guide they give you (the question mark when opening all menu tabs in game) is exactly what you need for first time players. Without that thing I probably would be dying from no oxygen or food trying to figure out what to do to make my stuff.

A smaller problem I had was dying to open wounds and poison because I had no resources yet to make items to cure this stuff and THEY NEVER WEAR OFF!!!! So you are forced to die at beginning if you end up getting hit by enemies but at least you respawn near the stuff you dropped.

You may have a hard complicated time at the beginning but it soon becomes a freaking amazing game once you get on your feet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very intreging game to play. The initial start is kind of rough, though the in depth tutorial (which I feel is a bit OP) goes through everything from making basic items to building vehicals and ships.

Not for everyone, this game starts you out with basic survival resources that do not last very long. I recommend playing first a 'scratch' game to get the feel of how this game works, follow the tutorials to their letter when they pop up and don't do much else beside gathering needed resources when needed.

Once you complete all the lessons/quests/tutorial THEN restart the game with a fresh start and go at it full force with a good understanding of the game. It is fairly easy to master and get use to while in solo mode. I have not played multiplayer yet.

For the $10 purchase while on sale, I feel it is well worth the purchase. I have gotten my money worth from the free weekend already and feel I will get more than $10 of play time into this game from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've gotten my money's worth even if the promised updates never happen.

Been playing for hours. Started on a terrestrial planet, shooting dinosaurs and making them into salami. Started building a cabin. Hid in unfinished cabin from hovering murder drones in the dark. Rigged cabin with basic survival gear. Mined ore. Built a hovercraft. Traveled farther in search of ore. Shot down more drones and horrible plant monsters. Built a little spaceship. Mined an asteroid and the moon while trying not to attract drones' attention. Died repeatedly trying to mine cobalt on the home planet. Now I'm assembling a capital ship in orbit, big enough to walk around in, and haven't even gone to the other planets yet. I have also not decided where to install the shower in my cabin, and the farm I built is producing more wheat than I know what to do with.

The bad: some details seem clunky, like vehicle headlights and my ship's tendency to roll over despite my attention to thruster placement and landing gear. (If it handles badly, it seems to be partly your fault, since you build ships block by block.) Saved games have a hidden catch that the game you last loaded/saved is constantly updated, eg. with you having just lost all your stuff, so whenever you load your first action should be to make a backup save. You also can't name a save file until you're back at the menu. Some other features seem unfinished, like the so-far pointless Talon Temple and a lack of feedback when shooting drones/creatures. The tutorial is still clunky too.

The good: Lots of things to do and some clear challenges to work towards. The developers have already made improvements based on feedback from the free weekend, which bodes well for them actually updating again.

Versus other games: Way better than Starbound in terms of respecting their Early Access players and making stable updates. Versus Space Engineers it's more of a tossup; the focus here is on planets rather than some of SE's elaborate engineering. I find that this game runs planets easily, whereas planets in SE make my 4 GB RAM computer weep. It's mostly a matter of taste to pick this versus SE; do you want things to shatter impressively and have elaborate conveyor/vent/control panel systems (SE) or grow crops and shoot some aliens (Empyrion)?

So i played a few hours, built myself a little base, very little happened the tutorial was weak didnt really explain much at all
the same issues most other players have, why am i prioritising oxygen production when the planets full of it? why doesnt food stack? etc etc

i was going to leave a bad review, i decided to restart a new game, ignore the tutorial and just build on my own, on entry to the planet i made straight for an island in the middle of a lake, looked like a good spot for a defensive base
i spent most of the day yesterday building up that base, got myself defensive turrets, walls, towers even a landing pad from the lake for my hover craft.
Finding resources wasnt easy, i was close to cobalt and silicon but they arent much use in a firefight when i need iron and magnesium for bullets
things got rough, i spent an entire night locked in my house because a plant monster was trying to get in to kill me and i didnt have any bullets left.
Drones came and attacked my base, they destroyed the turret on my roof and the roof caved in, i was forced to fight them off from a doorway with only my pistol.

dont get me wrong, its rough, buggy, eveythings too blocky, no back story, but then its in alpha, i only hope the devs continue their patches and updates because it really could be something amazing

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I played a few hours over the free weekend. I don't know about the endgame content because I didn't get there, however, The early game is fun and you can tell the developers have put time into the crafting system and the building system.

If you want to build an item but you don't have the required parts you can que up the parts you need and then que the Main thing you wanted to build after it and it will build in order, which is simple and awesome. Having the ability  to build a plane of blocks with a click of a button instead of individually placing each of those 1,000+ blocks is a HUGE timesaver.

I would definitely recommend this game to survival enthusiasts when it's on sale. I also feel a large amount of people will find the game worth the $17.99.

Cons:

1. You can fly from the planet into outer space with no cutscene, however, you do suddenly get teleported into outer space, there is a very obvious change in the backdrop that kills the immersion.

2. The game runs fairly well on my pc. I have a GTX 970 and a i7 920 @ 2.67 ghz. I believe if I overclocked my cpu the game would run much smoother.

3. Depending on the server and other player's connection to the server, you will frop frames. I normally have around 30-60fps and when I joined different servers, with only one person remotely near me, I dropped to below 15fps.

4. You cannot explore the entire planet, while being quite large, there are playable zones that you cannot walk/fly past.

Even with all of the cons this game is still very enjoyable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hi Everyone!
I usually do not write reviews, but this game has me amped. As such here we go.

TLDR:
Great game. The engine is stable for an alpha, playability is there. At this point in time dedicated servers are not out yet, however ad-hoc direct ip connect does exist, allowing people to multiplay to their hearts content. The gameplay itself is great, if not a little unforgiving (But its survival! We didn't sign up for a good hand-holding, for that I go to my depraved Grandmother).

You can craft, run around on multiple (yes, multiple planets!), to which the transition is seamless. Build ground bases, space stations, ground vehicles, small ships and large ships! Enemies prowl planetary surfaces and the deep black. As such standard military and navy doctrine is a must (Recon, Adapt, Overcome). Resources are minable and the crafting is intuitive.

Pros:
- Planets!
- Planets with enemies!
- Planets with secret artifacts!
- Crafting (Build ships,bases,groundvehicles, space stations)
- The worlds are huge... literally.
- Good graphics (I know they are not cutting edge, but hey even with a large block-count theres no FPS drops, unlike Space Engineers which slows to a crawl at times).

Cons:
- The UI at this time is very clunky. The crafting menu is horrendous, but workable.
- The usual alpha issues like enemy path-finding, and rough edges like hover-crafts having a few issues with hills.
- Water is pretty much just static.
- Lacking a tutorial (Had to look around how to power-on a base (by pressing Y on the generator..))


All in all, I haven't been this excited about a game in a long time. There is SO MUCH potential here, which is already being realised within the early access build. The engine is surprisingly stable, the devs seem to know what they are doing. I am honestly looking forward to its evolution and will be supporting it throughout its infant state. If you are looking for a mix between Space Engineers, Starbound, Starmade and other survivals like 7 days to die, this is for you.

Enjoy, adventurers, I know I will.
Rannekk, signing off.

The game is a must buy. The space features are aboslutely unparalled to anything I've experienced before. 5/5.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI thoroughly enjoy playing this game.  Even without too much polish or challenge from the NPC (Creatures, Drones, etc...) population you will occasionally die or be faced with decisions on whether to try and make it to a resource with the oxygen you have.  I would love to see some lore and more points of interest on each planet.  For Alpha, the game is very and I've only encountered minor bugs with picking up things.  I would like to see a surveying component added in order to find/trace resources, rather than the random discovery method in place now.  I have encountered issues with running out of Iron and not being able to find any after blindly flying all over the planet.  I think a surveying/resource allocation scheme like from Star Wars Galaxies would be great.  So that you can always find ore, even if in small amounts in thinner seams for instance.  Either way, me and my kids love playing this so far.  More planets would be nice as well.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is nice. dont let the 7 min of gameplay fool ya, i have been playin this game for hours on end, sadly i am unable to play it on my pc so i had to play it on a friend's rig (Some wierd issue with Themedia being a jerk, i have tried to solve it with no results sadly so it seems i wont be playing it in the near future)

Even tho i cannot actualy play this game im still recommending it, why? you ask, and thats a fair question so leme elaborate:

-Optimization is good. This is probably the biggest con with this game, recently i have encountered ALOT (most even) of early access games that look like ♥♥♥♥ and are literaly unplayable on medium PC rigs, this one dosent have this problem. Some of you might say that the graphics are not amazing, and its true, they are pretty crappy but the animation quality is decent and the graphics aint that hidious to ruin the game for you and the game does compinsate for it by having a rly high FPS.

-Content. This is a Pre-Alpha release (personaly i dont think pre alphas should be even allowed on steam, we have kickstarter and such for that but still) it has alot of ♥♥♥♥ to do, u get 4 planets (1 is a moon) asmall asteroid field and some space stations u can shoot at for your amusment (be carefull tho - they shoot back!)

-Music, the music is really good, the sound isnt, the sound is extreamly buggy and just overlaps, plays in inaproprite moments etc' but its a pre-alpha release so i dont hold it against the game. The music on the otherside is pretty epic and by epic i literaly mean the Epic music genere" the into theme song sounds like something "Two steps from hell" would have made.

-Crafting

recommended: mainly it being a pain in the ♥♥♥ as u need to craft ingots -> materials -> whatever u need to make which just adds pointless fiddeling and annoyence and is extreamly slow and the UI dosent give u enough info of how much of a certain resouce u have (again
hoursPlayed: pre-alpha excuse

Nothing much to say really

votesTotal: small vessels are da ♥♥♥♥
votesFunny: u might aswell not bother with the "Capital vessels" which are basicly flying bases and the deffences require manning the station which means u cant fly-and-shoot and the armor/hull blocks really need a balancing since anything tougher then a paper plane breaks them immidiatly.\n\nNow for the negatives

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Me and a couple friends have been playing this a bit lately and basically at every turn we find ourselves getting screwed over by the harsh, unforgiving desert hellscape or starving of oxygen on the frozen, icy hellscape. Many times over we have built basic ships for travel, only to have them rekt by the drones. As of last night, we had to restart from our original world after losing the last of everything we had in a glitched re-entry of Omicron, destroying all of our mining equipment, constructors, O2 reserves, food, everything was lost. We had no choice but to restart. We've already encountered construction problems and loss of inventory bags upon death. This game is unforgiving and it doesn't discriminate between the victims whose poor souls these astral bodies claim.

10/10 Can't wait for the alpha.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game popped out of nowhere close to a year ago, and the speed and quality of the game progressing kept me coming back to it. One of the best games on PC for its low cost they do raise the price slowy as they add new content so pick it up quickly, similar to the concept of No Mans Sky coming out soon, crashing in a survial escape pod with limited resources in random areas, planets you can choose. The fact you are rushing to survive one hour from hostile alien life or machines the next exploring space just by simply building a ship and leaving the atmostphere. The beginning of the game may not be clear what you need to do and is slow but once you get going the adventure goes on and on. Any fans of sandbox games have to try it out, the graphics may not be all there lol, but the gameplay and community are. The devlopers of this game have been steadly updating adding new content at least one or two weeks at a time so the game just feels fresh with some new content. The largest patch opening into aplha stage as of 4/15/2016 has added the most yet. The game has no minor transactions just one time buy and you get all the content.Overall easy game to learn and play, really fun. Building can be hover vehicles, space fighters, large capital ships, and of course stationary bases in a space or planetside. Also everything in between you can come up with. Good customization. Highly recommended game if you are reading this and are interested you could be missing out.

Cons to the game it is early stages and are some bugs some that can be annoying.
Alot of content is there but not finished.
No real tutorials so new players may have a hard time at first.
Bad AI oppenents regardless of what they are.
Punishing deaths if you arent carefull where you are, such as space, lava planets or inside large structures. Getting your stuff back could be difficult somtimes. Just carry back up supplies.
Game isnt polished enough where is needs it, little things like guns not have reloading animations, or strange character animations.

But keep in mind they update the game constantly so all my complaints could change in a week. Not to mention what all they have planned for the future. If you get it good luck and have fun watch out for plant monsters, and 15-20 capital ships surrounding yours like police in mutiplayer lol!
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start off by saying that this is the first review I've ever written.

This game is fantastic. Playing in the pre-alpha felt like playing a full priced game. The devs update constantly and just released the full Alpha 1.0 update that includes a huuuuuge list of features, fixes, and gameplay elements.

You get to constantly explore new areas, places of interest, and worlds. You can fully excavated and mine landscapes, building bases into mountains or seas. The freedom of creation of Minecraft with better graphics, space exploration, guns, aliens, etc. Buy this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the most fantastic survival/building game I've ever played. I love it.
It's still pre-alpha and way better than some of the finished survival games I've seen. I can't wait to see what they have in store for the Alpha release!

Space flight has never been so fun!

Edit as of Feb 18 2016:
I hate the leveling system. It almost completely ruined the game for me.
If the stats and skills carried over to other worlds then great, but as of right now this is complete crap.

Edit March 7 2016:
The leveling system isn't much of a bother after you've hit max level, but starting out it makes crafting incredibly difficult and building decent crafts or weapons even harder.

This is still one of my most favorite games. Customizing, building, and creating my own bases, ships, and Capital Vessels is truly satisfying. Shooting through space blowing up enemy bases and drones in a vehicle completely of my own design - nothing better. Even just flying around looking for ore to mine makes me feel on top of the world!

The combat system has really been revamped since I played last. The new AI and enemy mobs is terrifying! I usually play games in a hardcore" type way so that if I die I just delete the world and start over
date: and normally I'm extremely careful when approaching enemies
recommended: BUT HOLY CRAP. I have never had to be THIS careful! Literally hiding behind destroyed enemy drones to avoid cannon fire
hoursPlayed: or enemy aliens with machine guns. Sniping from just behind a hill
voteText: and finally resorting to flying a ship decked out in rocket launchers just to take out a few ground troops. It makes danger real.\nAnd yes it's still in pre-alpha O_O\nThe Alpha release is scheduled for the end of this month and I cannot wait for it!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a good game, even in current state (alpha 1.5.2). You can easily enjoy hundreds of hours of gameplay, especially if you play multiplayer.

Pros:
-Fun exploration, building, survival
-Runs well, needs an ok PC, nothing super fancy (don't try running on a potato though)
-Lots of future promise that can be realistically achieved
-Frequent updates, new features, fixes (no major bugs, minor things occasionally pop up and get fixed quick)
-Good devs
-Excellent community, active and helpful
-Lots of moding/tweaking potential. You can literally design your own planets and planetary system, it does take a little knowledge and research though.
-You can download ridiculous workshop designs, from any sci-fi universe you can imagine. Walk around on those ships/stations and make them fully functional. I mean the game is the ultimate sci-fi playground.

Cons:
-All cons I can think of are related to current Alpha, as in not enough desired features implemented yet (always want more and want them NOW...).  Though literally all those things can be realistically implemented with time, most of the systems are already in place just need polishing or are planned.
For example:
- Only 1 solar system in game right now, want entire procedural galaxy
- Don't have some basic items like shields or landing bay doors for cap ships
- Want better AI, more AI, more aliens, friendly aliens, alien traders
- Want a story, reason to build, reason to fight, reason to explore
- Want more rare items (some epic non-craftable items just went in a few patches ago, want more stuff)
- Need more convenience for tweaking game and running server, like better UI and more options type of deal for admins
- Want research/science and so on.

You get the idea, all cons are pretty much planned to be eliminated. If you buy this game you're buying hundreds of hours of fun gameplay as is, plus thousands more promised (and IMHO can be delivered by this dev team judging by what I have seen since very early release on Steam).
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overall, awesome game!
But remember, Its an Alpha...

If you're looking for fun, you've found it!!!!

I've just spent the past hour trying to get my gear back.
See, I died 300m from a base on a lvl 5 planet...
my ship got demo'd as soon as i got within 450m (ship guns are uneffective at this range, have to get close to demo ai base)...
now the thing you need to know is... when you die and spawn in, you spawn in with nothing... you cant make anything to defend yourself...
so, with that being said...
spawn in, dead before my player shows up on screen...
spawn in, move 1 foot, dead
spawn in, and move immediately... shot in the head by a plasma cannon... are you guys using legit ai... cause I didnt even know i was going to move that way... how did they know i was going to move that way before i knew... maybe their guns are made of triangles... ... with eyes painted on... ...
spawn in multiple times and sometimes make it to my backpack, then die... causing a giant crater to form where my gear is...
now it seems every hostile creature on the planet is in the crater with my gear, there is at least 20 of them... and they are all stuck in the crater...
now I know most of you would give up... but not me!!!
Im smrt... right... ok... lets keep dying, but infront of my gear so it makes a larger crater that the creatures get stuck in so im free to get my gear...
BRILLIANT IDEA!!!!
Now there is a hole 20m - 40m deep going through an entire mountain... yes... an entire mountain...
and all of the creatures and my backpack are still in there...
oh... did I mention that I also tried killing the creatures with splash damage from the ai attacks on me... yea... ai has friendly fire turned on... good times...


Pro's
-build ♥♥♥♥
-kill ♥♥♥♥
-take ♥♥♥♥ over
-horde
-updates all the time

Con's
-ion cannons are op - why cant I have op ion cannons?
-ai has some magic abilities
-ai has friendly fire off
-disappearing worlds (parts at least) - relog and they showup again
-giant ants are op
-i want my gear back
-desync issues... causes different players to see things in different spots.

This game has awesome potential!
I have really enjoyed playing it so far.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Disclaimer* I will not be buying the game since it just isn't for me, but it is not a reflection on the game and I would still recommend it to anyone.

If you do survival, pick the planet that is already selected. The second planet, although I have not tried it, claims to be harder. To start, you come down to the planet in an escape pod that you can slowly steer. Once you land, grab everything out of the pod and follow the directions to begin working on a base. If you chose the first planet and not the other, you can take your helmet off since you only need it in space, on a harder planet, or underwater.

The graphics, although dated, were not an issue for me at all. I love the destruction in this game. You use a drill tool that actually works more like a flamethrower/torch and you can make your own caves and whatnot. I'm sure if you wanted to, you could have a completely underground base and avoid drones or at least make it harder for them to attack.

In single-player, there is room for error and you can just make saves and re-load, but online I assume is much less forgiving, although from what I've read, the community is very nice and will have no problem lending a hand.

While it is free, give it a try or if you don't mind paying the small fee, just buy it and play a bit.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

a little better than I thought. The only slight down side is running out of resources if you are not careful and not being able to get them back at all or without a great amount of effort. I got stuck on the moon because a drone blew up my crafts fuel tank. I had every I needed to craft a new one, but because my crafting station attacheted to my aircrafted was not powered I could not craft a new one. I ended up using console commands to teleport my ♥♥♥ back to the home planet.

I would recommend the game designer allow you to build a emergy fuel tank and power source so you don't get stranded in the middle of no where.

To counter that one problem if you just have enough resources in the blueprint factory you can just spawn a whole new ship. A quick note on that is the reason why I got stuck in the middle of no where is because I spawned one of those. Their fuel tanks and power supplies are not well protected. I would not recommend flying a prebuilt ship to far away from base. It is a good idea to spawn one to get an idea of what or how you should build, but I would not recommend taking them into a fight or travel anywhere without first buffing up the defenses and changing some stuff. You can also save your custom built ship or any you built. So that is awesome right there. It is a pain to build ships in planets if you do not know what you are doing. Make sure you put boosters on the bottom so it can hover off the ground otherwise you willd not be able to build under it. There should be a rescipe for solar power panels. Running out of power sucks.

Everything else is pretty alright. Shooting works, enemy strong holds to take over for loot/exp, and a good amount of guns and crafting options.

I just wish I couldn't grind myself into a whole by accident or just get stuck in the middle of no where. It is important to mention if you are prepared enough you can fix up your broken ship. I just hope it doesn't get blown up.

If you like games like Grave, minecraft, and subnautic you might like this. Just don't dig your own grave while mining.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright, so  after playing almost sixty hours of this game I think I can give a fair estimate as to what it truely is. mind you, Empyrion is one of those gems out there with the ever growing survival genre.  It definitley takes the cake when it comes to both creativity and uniqueness.  With its rather complex, but not totally overly complex crafting sytem it makes sense for seems to be a human in a masseffect era universe.  Graphics and rendering are still beautiful albite in what definately looks to be an alpha game.  This isn't bad at all, because while I traverse the vastness of space, I can see such beautiful scenes that make me what to snap them as a desktop background or even write a story.  Animals, enemies, and movine living things all are highly unique and while as of now still need some work on basic things link there hit box, or there method of attack, they are still very well-made.  I do hope to see further improvement which can range anywhere from big stuff like better gamepad compatability to the small stuff like a dinosaur getting stuck in a cave I made and then proceeding to block the way.

Though would be projected far in the future, I would love to see a randomly generated world down to every rock and corn dog it is random.

I would highly recomend this game to people who enjoy survival building games as it has many key elements you don't see in other games from this genre

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo I played it during the too short free weekend, and even though I ont have the cash to buy it I have to say this game is pretty good. Obviously it draws similarities to Space Engineers but is strikingly different. While I never made it to space (which was a bummer) the game handled itself quite well. Only sour note was the remote drone you pilot for building is overly sensitive and wonky to control, a shame too since it would be so useful in building. Combat with hostile drones was a tense experience with only an AR and pistol (dont fight Missle Drones with a pistol) and them attacking the base even when your away always leaves a sense of worry. If you keep track of it hunger is no problem but keeps you focused on a sense of human need without being an overbearing issue. Hunting down and mining the ores you need is somewhat time consuming but doesnt feel redundantly so. I did like though how the terrain deformed against my mining. Overall I would definately buy this down the line.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've sunk many hours into this game already and I highly recommend it to anyone who dreams of flying off the planet in a cool spaceship and explore other worlds. The crafting of vessels I have to say feels really polished these days. It has improved since pre-alpha. The survival aspect has also become more polished and believable since pre-alpha, since now you start out with crappier tools, and it is harder to aquire tier 2 weapons and tools.

Here is a short list of things that make the game shine like a diamond:
-the devs are responsive to feedback and listen to what the players want
-I don't want to say this is Minecraft in space, although it does have a minecraft feel to it, so if you loved that game, you should love this one as well
-plenty of weapons to arm yourself, your small ships or your large capital vessels with.
-you get a great rewarding feeling after completing a build and actually getting to fly it around as transport, raid alien bases with it, and eventually lose it in an epic battle :)
-The game is what you make of it. You can invent your own story and build your own mega base or star destroying hunk of metal.
-the multiplayer is decently fun

Some of the bad things:
-I have lost many builds due to game ending bugs that cause me to have to wipe a save. If you are going to play the game you must blueprint everything you build often and be ready to start over from scratch. It's still in alpha.
-Ever since they released the alpha the planets Masperon and Austus became much harder to survive on with drones everywhere and wildlife ready to sink their teeth into you. Not that this is a bad thing, but the graphics requirements of the game went up dramatically as well! So now a game that I used to be able to play on the fast graphics setting is now a game that only gets 6 to 7 frames per second on those planets, which makes them even harder. It's my fault since I didn't check the minimum graphics requirements before buying it, but its odd that they dramatically increased the punishing graphics on those planets.

The game is already great and it is still being developed. I probably won't play it much anymore until I get a computer that is dedicated to gaming (which could be a long time). However, in the mean time I will support the development of the game and could see something like this eventually coming to PS4 or Xbox. Wink Wink ;) However, If the devs were able to fix the graphics issue on planets somehow, that would be great. I definitely got my moneys worth even though I can't play it enjoyably at the moment.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off, this is a review of Pre-Alpha, and I will update this review as the game progresses.

I highly recommend this game, and if you are a fan of games like Space Engineers, Starbound, etc this game lines up nicely with that kind of gameplay. HOWEVER, as with all Pre-Alpha games not everything is in the game, optimized, etc so the negative reviews that are critizing this game against games that have been out longer is silly.

PROS
- Developers have been good at communicating, as I've gotten personal responses from the team.
- Despite no being optimized, in nearly 55 hours of gameplay I've only encountered minor hiccups and 1 major bug.
- Hunger/Oxygen mechanics are present, but not overdone. 3 hours and only had to eat 4x, etc.
- Building mechanics are familiar enough to get started right away, but not just reskinning another game's base parts.
- Multiplayer is functional, and I've gotten up to 5 people in one game at once with little issue.
- Relatively seamless transition from planet to space and back.

CONS
- Pre-Alpha means features aren't all present, it's not optimized, and there will be bugs.
- Multiplayer has everyone restricted to same instance" at once

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fantastic game. Surprisingly stable and feature rich for a pre-alpha. If it's this good in pre-alpha, I cannot wait to see how good it gets upon release. At $17.99, it's a steal! I've paid $60 for less entertaining and fun games.

----- EDIT---------

OK... I've been playing it a lot and wanted to update my review.

It’s been said many times in these reviews, but Empyrion Galactic Survival is very much like Space Engineers with a little less engineering and a LOT more fun.

I very much enjoyed Space Engineers but it didn’t take long to see that unless you played multiplayer pvp, you quickly ran out of things to do. No NPCS, no planets to explore, no real reason to continue unless you just want to expand your base. Empyrion fixes all of that and simplifies ship\station ase creation a bit by taking out the tedious bits while maintaining the sense of accomplishment that comes with crafting new gear. With strange alien worlds to explore, alien beasts to hunt for food, plants to gather, food, medicines and weapons to craft, crashed mother ships to loot, bases to build and ships to build and perfect it seems like there is ALWAYS something to do and some new goal to set.

As for multiplayer, my step-son and I managed to get a game going peer-to-peer and it really was surprising how well it ran at this early stage in development. Last time I tried multiplayer with Space Engineers it was a laggy mess with the net code being in serious need of attention. EGS, however, is showing great promise on this front. No dedicated server or simplified server riends list yet, but playing in peer-to-peer mode was great with little to no lag and few bugs that we could see. We actually had a great deal of fun.

In short: This game is amazing. It really is incredible what they’ve managed to do with the Unity engine. I’m quite glad they utilized Steam’s early release program. The developer is very active and responsive to the community and responds to bugs and even some enhancement requests fairly quickly. They’ve even posted polls asking what players want to see be implemented from the road map next. They seem to be intent on crafting a game the players want to play. I have paid $60 for games I’ve gotten less entertainment and fun out of than Empyrion Galactic Survival. Get it now while it’s cheap! Support the development. If it’s THIS good in pre-alpha, I can’t wait to see how good it gets in Alpha and ultimately, release.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFirst off let me say that I have never written a review for a game.  This game however is different.  I have already over 40 hours into the game and have enjoyed every minute of it.  This game can have a steep learning curve.  You have to manage resources very carefully at the beginning of the game.  Oxygen and Power are a must.  With out them you die,  and can never recover.  After the first couple of days, so long as your getting the things you need, you never really run out of resources.  I put in a method of mining during the day and doing all the other stuff at night.  I have so many resources now its not even funny. I don't find the constructor screen that annoying.  There are some glitches in the game, like falling through the planet when your mining, and silicon looks soo much like rock that it is hard to mine sometimes.  The building of your ships is a little problematic right now, because you can't access the bottom of your ship until you put everything on and hover it.  The is a max speed that you can not go over, no matter how many accelerators you put on it.  Ship to shp combat in space can be a little troublesome some times.  Even with all the issues, Remember that it is still early access and it was just released not too long ago on steam.  I am hoping the develepers stay with it and put everything on their roadmap into the game.  I think they have a jewel here, just needs to be polished a little.  If there are any gamers out there looking for some multiplayer action of team work and are good people hit me up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok as promised I would update my review as needed. Before I would not have recommended the game but it has matured very well in a short time frame. Now the game keeps getting into better shape and additions are coming at the expected pace which is very fast compared to the empty promises of almost all other early access games. I say expected pace, don't take that as a neg. All early access games promise to develop at this pace and I say again nearly all early access games don't deliver. Cannot point that out enough.

To put a review of this game short, it's Space Engineers with less focus on pure building and more focus on a playable survival mode where you gather resources, manage your own life support, and attempt to build and thrive in a hostile environment. Basically the stuff that is missing in Space Engineers that makes it a boring sandbox, this game focuses on that stuff. And it's still a great building, station, and ship builder much like Space Engineers with lots of possibilities. For anyone who hasn't played Space Engineers but have at least played Minecraft this is like a sci-fi version of Minecraft, except the world isn't blocky and instead looks much more natural and it is based in sci-fi instead of medieval quasi-magic-whatever. A key difference is in this game you can make functional vehicles out of blocks, vehicles with weapons to boot.

Another important aspect for any gamer out there is the ability to fly from space to a planet and have a large map for said planet and move around on the planet with freedom. Not many games achieve this. In fact as I type this review all I can think of honestly is Universal Combat, that game also allows you to fly, swim, walk, or ride across the landscape as you will and transition into space and go to other planets. Empyrion is nothing like Universal Combat in any way except in sharing a sci-fi vibe and the planet to space transition, but I got the point across. This sort of transition has been the goal of gamers and devs since at least 2000 if not prior. Empyrion does it. So far you only have the one system to stay in with a few planets and some stuff in space, supposedly we are going to get randomly generated systems in the future which would be great. As it sits now there are finite resources in the entire system, once out they are out. Do not fret though, there is more than plenty enough resources sitting around to make a lot of stuff with. I mean a lot, it's not likely you will dry up the entire system currently in the game.

And do not freak out about the Prometheum fuel, yes everything you do pretty much uses up energy and the only form of energy is an ore that will dry up on you. The past update Prometheum was made more abundant and lots of people keep talking about adding solar panels for long-term low power draw purposes like simply running water pumps, oxygen pumps, and grow lights for plants so you can survive and explore safely without constantly drawing on a finite fuel supply. Cannot say it enough, once you get to the first moon or another planet you will realise there is a lot of Prometheum and it's not really a worry, you will be bored long before you truly have a hard time getting fuel.

Devs have shown good support for a while and I am a hard person to please when it comes to early access, I'm one of those who are still upset about Starbound and have been of the opinion for a long while that overall early access is a failure. Empyrion and a very few other games do early access right. It's a blend of Minecraft survival, Space Engineers construction, and sci-fi combat against aliens and creatures on land and in space. Would I recommend this game? Yeah, it's under $20 and keeps getting better.

I was given Empyrion for my birthday today, and managed some time to play it for a good hour. This game does seem well thought out. There are many diverse types of plants, planet terrains/environments, and the survival aspect is well thought out, needing to eat, sleep and stay hydrated. There are many different weapons to choose from, a lot of food options (space pizza anyone?), NPCs , and lots of construction options.

That being said, it took me a good 20 minutes to even start playing, due to my world name. There is no check for illegal filename characters when creating a new save, and my save title just happened to have a colon in it. Rather than give me a simple warning about my filename, I ended up getting Internal Error Occured".

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction
Empyrion - Galactic Survival is not only an 3D open-world game, it is in fact a multiple open-worlds game! After surviving a crash landing on your choice of two planets (initial difficulty choice), you must find some way to survive. With each world being procedurally generated based on the selected seed, you will always be able to start fresh on a new unknown world.

Gameplay
Currently just freshly entering Alpha, this game already has a lot to offer. You are able to explore the surface of the planet you are on. During your adventure you will find resources you can harvest, alien structures to explore and creatures of all shapes and sizes freely roaming around. This is all very visually appealing. The hospitable world looks lush and vibrant; the dessert planet looks desolate and inhospitable and these are just your two starting planets. Once you manage to cobble together a capital ship, you will be able to blast off and visit other worlds. The most notable of the additional planets is a lava covered volcanic planet. You definitely don’t want to go swimming there!

Speaking of swimming, you are able to enter the water in this game for even further exploration. So long as you are wearing your helmet you will be able to stay down until you run out of oxygen. Here you can harvest blue crystals and plants, both of which are very useful to your survival. Once you are finished exploring the surface and underwater, you will want to start exploring underground.

Underground is where you will find the majority of your useful materials. Luckily, unlike a certain popular procedurally generated diamond hunting simulator, as you explore the surface, your scanner will notify you of any mineral deposits located beneath the surface. Hopefully you will find some iron fairly quickly because iron is going to be your main resource for a while. Other deposits are quite useful too, but you will likely want to set up your first base near a nice lake and an iron deposit.

Base building is something I always enjoy. Being able to shape anything you want out of the elements given is always fun. You are not limited to just building a base in this game though, you can actually build yourself three types of vehicles too! The first being kind of like a hover car is better than walking. It allows you to get around much faster so long as you are crossing even terrain. The small aircraft is my vehicle of choice for planetary surveys. Unlike the hover vehicle, you are not limited to the surface so mountains and potholes can’t stop you. You can even take it out to orbit if you are so inclined, but you really can’t get anywhere in space with it. The last kind of ship is very much like the aircraft I just mentioned except this one is much bigger. While my design could land on a planet and take off again, it burned through fuel like crazy. Luckily in orbit of my home planet, I built myself a nice space base. That’s right, you are not limited to just building on a planet! My small vehicle, as it is called in game, flies between the surface and my space base. It lands in the hanger I built into my large capital ship. The capital ship itself is like a mobile base. It can do everything my planetary base and my orbital space base can do. I can fabricate, refine and grow anything I need. The only thing my planetary base can do that my space base and capital ship can’t do is harvest water and oxygen. Luckily I have massive oxygen and water storage capacity on my ship and space base.

Now why do I even want a mobile manufactory? The reason for that is quite simple! Space is vast. You are not limited to just one planet or one solar system in this game. There are multiple systems already available in this game. The warp drive found on my capital ship takes me and my small vehicle hitchhiking though the galaxy. It’s admittedly kind of a pain to have to build a new base on every single planet you land on so having my capital ship being capable of doing all the refining and manufacturing saves me time. I just take my small vehicle down to the surface of the planet; fly around until I find useful alien buildings, crashed ships or unique resources and then land. After I steal everything that isn’t bolted down, I just fly back up to my capital ship to head off on a new trek through the galaxy.

Sadly, space is very, very lonely. Even though you find friendly aliens and creatures, none of them talk to you or help you in any way. Sure shooting them or hacking them up with a chainsaw gives you some supplies, but that is about as much interaction as they are willing to do. Luckily, this game supports multiplayer! Now when you venture off into space you will find other people willing to co-operatively play with you… or willing to kill you and take everything you have for their own. Multiplayer is probably where this game will shine down the road. Exploring in single player will eventually make you realize that no matter how cool you make your base or ship look… you are only doing it to impress yourself or anyone who happens to take a look at your screenshots…. Well that’s not entirely true either! This game already supports Steam Workshop! There are plenty of player made blueprints available right now for those of you who are not creative enough or patient enough to build something yourself, or alternatively, you can share your awesomeness with the world.

The game currently offers both Creative Mode and Survival Mode. Creative, as you might have guessed, gives you full access to everything the game offers right off the bat. You don’t even have to take a single step before you have built your very first capital ship. Survival is where the real fun of the game comes in. You have to scavenge, harvest and mine for everything. Your food and oxygen levels need to be maintained as well. Depending on which world you start in, you might be able to breathe the atmosphere so you can survive without your helmet on. On another world, you will suffocate quickly if you don’t swiftly set yourself up an oxygen reclamation plant. Hunger will always nag at you. You will need to hunt the creatures of the world you are on and hope you can cook their meat into something edible. If you are a vegan, you can also just live off the plants that are scattered around too. You will eventually be able to farm for your own food if you are so inclined. The last stat that drops is health. If you fall too far, run into violent creatures or eat something that doesn’t agree with you, your health will fall. If it hits zero you will die and drop all the stuff you are carrying. You are given the option to respawn near to where you died in the hopes of reclaiming your backpack, or you can respawn at your base if you have a cloning chamber installed. You will have to manually find and build everything you want, or at least collect everything you need to build the blueprint you have.

Unlike most games in Early Access or that are in the Alpha phase, Empyrion is already full featured and well-polished with minimal bugs. There is already a tutorial in the game that optionally holds your hand by guiding you on what you should do next until you have built your very first base and vehicle.

Pros:Despite being in Early Access and in Alpha, it already has fairly solid gameplay. Many features are already present
Vibrant looking landscapes that are procedurally generated make each world look unique even if you are replaying the game
Comprehensive tutorial that lets you figure things out on your own with the option for it to spell it out to you if you are stuck

Cons:
Some glitches do occur, but this is forgivable due to the Alpha status
Gravity is weird! You can sometimes defy gravity if you turn off the power to your ship
Hover vehicle is kind of useless as it tends to easily get stuck. The small vehicle costs pretty much the same to make and can fly

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a review for Empyrion - Galactic Survival

GameplayThe game is about exploring planets and space.
You start on a planet with only your landing stuff and have to survive and build up your base. There is a lot of mining involved, but after a while you can build smaller and bigger vessels. with these you can explore the space and other universes.
As of now, there is not enough late-game content, so you maybe feel bored after getting your first capital vessel.
Digging is voxelbased, which just looks and feels great.


GraphicsThe Graphics are not the best, not photorealistic, but good enough for a game of this size.
On max settings you can even call it beautiful.
The game is very good optimized and runs on 60 FPS or even more.

ControlsEvery key can be changed, which is nice. The game recognizes special keys.
The controls are very precise and instantaneous.

SummaryIt's worth the money. It makes more fun playing on a server with friends, but you can even play in singleplayer.
The game is seriously missing late-game content. After your first capital vessel and warping to other galaxies the game becomes boring. It's just mining for endless hours.
Updates are coming regulary, mostly once or twice per week.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been playing this game since its inception.
Best game on Steam, great developer, fantastic community.

And now it is on sale for 10 bucks!?!
Dont hesitate, just buy it now.
This game is worth far more...

What to add that hasnt been said in all the other reviews...hmm, not much.
Except that it is ALL TRUE.

And it all comes down to the devleopers.
They have listened so closely and intently to the players throughout development...
What results is a game with enourmous creative potential, balanced crafting wihtout being too grindy, and an ever improving multiplayer experience.  Constant updates mean bugs die fast.

Grab your friends or go make some new ones on one of the many fantastic servers out there.
Maybe I'll see you out there...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Straight up bad a$$ game! This is what Space engineers wanted to be and couldnt pull off! Very impressive game with lots and lots to do. Build a base and not a crappy 7days to die base alot more elaborate and not only a base but build your own Starship, hovering land cruiser and alot of cool crafting items! This game in my opinion is a mix between Star Wars Galaxies, Minecraft, and space engineers! Alot more things than space engineers could pull off and much easier to play :D


Update as of 11/25/2015

This game just keeps getting better and better! The devs have implemented Dedicated servers so now you can be on one planet and your buddy on another! Not to mention alot more new items and such plus they keep making old things better or bigger and better! This Developer team is a good one I look forward to newer games they will develop in the future (as long as it is Sandbox/survival) Keep on Rocking guys you kick A$$!

Do you want a game with frequent updates?
Do you want a game with infinite creation?
Do you want a game where you can make a millennium falcon and actually pilot it?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You start off screaming towards an inhospitable alien planet in an escape pod. Pretty soon, you are screaming away from that planet and out into the solar system. Or in my case, you forgot to place reverse thrusters on your first experimental ship and ended up crash landing on top of your base at 10 m/s.

This game appeals to your inner explorer, engineer, farmer, and dog fighter. It's already well worth the money, and the devs work hard (they've updated it around 4 times since I purchased it just over a month ago).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just picked this game up the other day and I'll throw out a review

Pros...

1. Very few bugs...i've fell through the world once and all items recovered after a relog other than that I can't say i've seen a bug yet.

2. Smooth Running

3. There is a ton of content even if it's in early alpha, i'm amazed this is a pre alpha game...seriously can't say enough about how incredibly together this game already feels.

Cons..

1. the game looks just ok...but honestly with the amount of content in here it's really not much of a concern I just don't sit around watching sunrises and sunsets or saying...oooh..honestly I don't have time I have been getting into space.

2. bit of a learning curve...(don't mind this at all, I mean you're learning what each piece of the landscape can be used for)

For the money and considering this is still early alpha if they continue in the same direction with this game it'll be my favorite space game if not favorite game...I'm certain they'll make this more multi player friendly later and with all there is to do i'm just plain excited about this game.  Would I recommend this...Yes...the content in this game so far is enough to make it worth the price if not more.  If you want a survival...land to space...build your own ships...land speeders...fight drones to disgusting creatures...this game to me has it all and I can't wait to see what's around the next corner.  The first time I ventured into space was actually quite a rush.
