reviewText:
Early Access Review

I dont usually writes reviews but with how much I enjoyed this game I thought I would. Even though the game is in early access there is already a lot to do. You can raid enemy outpost which are guarded by turrets. Once you finally get past the turrets and make your way into the base you will be greeted with spawners which you have to take out or enemies will continue to spawn. Now that you have made it all the base to the end of the base and destroyed the core you can place your own core down and use the enemies base as your own.

One of the best aspects of this game is the ship building. Being able to download blueprints from the workshop is awesome since I rather suck when it comes to building things like that. There are a ton of amazing ships people have created.

Overall this is one of best early access games I have played and I have played quite a few. I hope this game continues to grow and becomes even greater.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game rules.  I have recently returned to playing after I purchased when it initially hit steam EA.  This game is so much better (not saying it was bad before but when it first came out it was VERY barebones).  The progress from the devs has been amazing. There are still some minor bugs here and there but nothing game breaking.  If you love building (block style) and exploring planets/space, crafting, mining resources etc then I highly recommend this game. It has great immersion.

Things I'd love to see in the future even if some of the items on this list are in progress (please read devs :)):
-More planets/asteroid types/shipwrecks in space/space stations etc (would require larger sectors)
-Trading/Dynamic economy
-More Loot/items/ores (especially more unique  rare/legendary drops that can't be crafted, therefore making the find more exciting).
-More creatures (and perhaps a taming/pet system.. hello ARK).
-As above but maybe introduce certain rare/hard to find species and have a beastiary of some sort to document your creature discoveries.
-Blocks need a little more hitpoints or maybe a shield system with it's own resource.. it's a little too easy to have hours of ship building get blown apart by a couple of plasma/rocket hits... Very sad when this happens haha.
-More Factions/Faction wars in single player
-Multiple saves

Once again, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and can't wait what the future has in store for the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL:DR:  Empyrion is definitely in its early stages, but I still thoroughly recommend it.

Good:
1. Lots of fun on multiplayer, and easy to set up over LAN
2. Getting to space feels like an achievement and the controls are FUN
3. Nice world design.  It's fluid and feels quite alien.
4. Very freeform.  The mining is great, basically you erode the ground to get to things then pick up ore.
5. Cool base building deisign with interesting components.

Mixed:
ADDICTIVE

Bad:
1. Can drop connections and lag easily.
2. Errors like enemies dropping through the floor are common
3. Textures still need work
4. The tutorial is definitely lacking - no option for skipping parts and you can easily do things in the wrong order

Summary:
I am very glad I bought it and I'm excited to see it develop and overcome some of the bugs :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An Early Access game that actually has stuff to do and is a great amount of fun.

The game is a kind of hybrid of Space Engineers, GRAV and 7 Days To Die. It has planets, moons, asteroid belts and lots of stuff to do and explore on all of those things. It has enemy AI for PvE lovers and special PvP systems for those that love that as well. It's a great game to play co-op too, with plenty of things to keep you occupied.

The survival mode features things such as a food and oxygen system, farming, building, mining, exploring and scavenging. Planets have randomly generated POI's to explore that include things such as crashed ships, scary abandoned mines (you will see why they were abandoned :-)), space ports and all other kinds of cool stuff. Enemy natives, drones and aliens are also thrown into the mix (something severly lacking from games such as Space Engineers).

Creative mode allows you free reign over everything you create and gives you unlimited resources to do so. The brilliant thing here is that you can design, create and test something there and then create a blueprint of it to bring into a multiplayer/survival game.

The building mechanics are superb - you can create some wonderful things - just see the workshop for this game to give you an idea. Bases, small ships, hover ships and capital ships are all buildable. It also features a brilliant blueprint system, whereby you can easily save and upload your creations for future use and to share with others.

It has multiplayer (as mentioned above), with dedicated servers which are a snap to set up. There seems to be a fairly large online presence for it too (although I host a private server). Single player works well too, if you are so inclined.

Simply put, this could well be my favourite early access game. It's a true joy to play, even in its early state. The developers also seem to be on the ball with frequent updates - and actually communicate with their community well (unlike other EA games). So, if you are a fan of the survival genre, sci-fi and building things - this may very well be just the ticket".

Jimbo Rating: 9/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To answer questions for those that keep asking me in Person if this game is worth Getting.
- YES

OK now to the important part's and what makes this game worth getting especially in early access.
- There is currently no precedieral generated worlds just yet but in my opinion that helps in getting to learn the mechanics of the game just as it is starting to be built.
- There is plenty of Guide and Tutorials to help you get started on the right foot for the Current Version Out.
- Clearly I recommend this game because playing COOP with friends is very enjoyable, and it helps along the person your joinings Single player game. (more on that later)
- You will get the chance to build yourself a good deal of things including a space ship from all the materials you harvest from the planet
- - Recommend a Ship over a Ground Vehicle as your first Vehicle in the game.
- - - Ship flight is a little wonky especially when you attempt to dog fight in space (second hand account on this)
- - - Ship fighting is combat by fixed mouse control. (would be a bit easier if you could fly by mouse pointer direction on the screen)
- - - Atmospheric flight to Space flight is kinda fun to switch between but you gotta make sure everyone that is playing with you is on the same ship as you.

For such a PRE-Alpha Early Access build of the game its got a good deal of Polishing needed, but contains plenty to keep you busy for a little while when you launch your own game.
- When you launch single player and have your ports open for 30,000 other players can join you in your saved game session for single player.
- You will find that you keep needing Oxygen and Food like you would any survival game, but this will always be a ticking clock to get enough of the right resources.
- - If you get the right things build together and put a few things into a Priority correctly and you can keep chugging along in the Galactic Survival.

Get this game early if your interested - because its worth it.
- if your not interested in an unfinished game then think about getting it early.
- if your not interested at all - then at least you took the time to read this Review.

Worthwhile for Pre-Alpha Purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok 16 hours into it so far, and I have explored all the planets, built 2 SV''s, a base and taken over or looted all towers in the game.  The game has a good foundation for what could be a really fun game, if they ever finish it of course, but I don't think just adding more planets is the answer, I think they need much more complex environments ON the planets and more tiers of equipment and items to mine or find, and this will be pretty good.

I would like to see the following added:
-More complex planets, meaning some tunnels, cities, more alien bases and other points of interest, etc.  Have these things have rare resources and such in them for giving you a purpose to do so.  Just something more diverse, that makes exploring the world a lot more fun as everything is pretty bland right now.
-Gamepad support
-Some enahanced features for your ships such as a radar, auto turrets on the ship, etc.
-more advanced construction tiers.


I like what is here so far, its actually pretty fun.  I mostly want to see some more complex environments added as the game progresses, with a LOT of locations thrown on each planet, areas for traversing on foot or in a space ship.


People unsure about it may want to wait a while of course.  As I said, I got about 16 hours out of it so far, so it payed for itself , but I want to see them reach their potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had been looking for a crafting open world game to fill out a few hours while I wait for Medieval engineers and rising world to mature a little. Browsing the store and seeing Empyrion there, but knowing nothing about it, I figured I would jump in without any research and grab a copy.

I purchased it, installed it, and bugger me, if eight hours didn't just evaporate right out from under me. It has been a long time since a game kept this jaded gamer so engrossed that he did not even notice the passing of time.

I will not bore folks discussing technical details and game mechanics, much of what you need to know is already covered here on the store page and in other reviews. I will say, despite owning a number of other titles in this genre, this is the first game in a very long time that has kept me engaged and glued to my seat for near eight hours straight.

Despite being in alpha I cannot fault it, and it is only going to improve with time; sure there are better looking games, there are also many worse. As of this write up, eight hours in, I have not even started building a space ship to leave the starting planet to venture out, and I have little idea what awaits me when I do, but I cannot wait to get back on and find out.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all sorry for my English because is not my first language.

I don't write reviews normally for games in early access or pre-alpha.... but I have to write a review for this game because
this game is possible the prototype of what is going to be one of the most ambitious games is a whole procedural galaxy where you can go and do whatever you want... I will define the game as a sandbox/survival/open galaxy game where you can build whatever you want... on the planets, moons, space... right now is only one solar system... and the planets have areas that you can't reach because the main engine of the game is not 100% complete.

But in the latest patches the performance of the game went in my computer to 20/30fps to a solid 60fps and with V-Sync, the developers are vergy active, they are showing like every week photos of what are they doing what is coming next and the game is getting bigger and bigger...

I made this video as my special tribute of what the game have... is a small video I don't show in the video the creatures and all the planets and all the spaceships and stations... is just only a little taste of what the game is right now and also you can see the performance because in this games performance is really important and I'm letting you know that
my computer is an AMD X4 965 3,4GHZ with 8GB Ram Ddr3 and Nvidia Gtx650 with 2Gb ddr5 and windows 7 64bit... have a look to the incredible performace while capturing the video...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzoemqR-ztA

Thanks.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is extremely addicting, fun, and challenging (for me, that is).

My first go, I got entirely too confident, built a giant base which nearly depleted my resources as I thought they would be easily found. Nope. Not the case. I am running low on resources to make additions to my base, and after beginning to craft a Hover Vessel, I finally deplete my last resource. Crud.

I start a new game, with the knowledge I gained my first try - plotting, planning carefully. Surely, nothing can go wrong, right? Wrong. I seemingly forget what I had learned, and dive right back into being overzealous.

I love this game, though. I know reading a lot of reviews that aren't on Steam itself, many seem to nag that the graphics are outdated. I find the game to be gorgeous and stunning, and there is so much to explore on the first planet that you choose to start on. My second startup, I landed next to a downed ship that had swarms of canon drones and minigun drones. And as soon as I started building a base, I got a warning that drones were coming to attack said base. Seriously, if you love space exploration, love crafting, and love challenges, and also want to be able to build a ship - be it a hover, small, or large ship - do yourself a favor and by this game.

10/10 Would definitely get raided by drones within five minutes again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is an alpha, and is in early access. Keep this in mind while reading reviews, and if you're thinking about buying the game. There's bound to be countless bugs or limitations as it currently stands. This is bound to change, and improve, so this review may or may not be misleading and outdated.

First off, I think Empyrion - Galactic Survival has great potential. The devs are active both community wise and update wise.  So I believe the game is going to shape up quite well. However, there are things to keep in mind.

In the current state of the game, it is enjoyable, and most of all, playable in singleplayer. I haven't played much of the game alone yet, since I prefer playing most games with a partner, which is what I did in this game aswell. After playing for two days, we had to stop. Every so often, my partner would lose everything he had in his inventory randomly, giving us massive blowbacks. We lost all our ores, and decided we'd wait for further updates before resuming playing this game, and exploring the surrounding planets and moons. Just going to say, I think the game is great for multiplayer.

Pros+
+Crafting
+Exploration(Captial ships and smaller ships)
+A decent amount of weapons available
+Creative mode
+Interesting wildlife/enemies (Dinosaurs, hellish creatures etc.)
+Survival (So you need to prepare if you're going to explore the surrounding planets)


Cons-
-Poor AI
-Only a few planets and moons
+-You die fast(can be taken both ways. I think it's alright, since getting stranded is an interesting predicament to be in)
-You cannot leave a planet without all players being in the same spacecraft.
-Poles are inaccessible
-Inventory is randomly cleared
-Crafting can be fidgety


TL;DR:
Great potential, it is fun, but has restrictions in it's current state. A decent amount of content, however I do expect more. Troublesome in multiplayer. You cannot leave a planet without bringing everyone. Items are randomly erased.
Recommending the game because I actually do find it fun, however it might be wise of you to hold off on buying it, which is what I usually try to do with early access titles, but with this one I couldn't help myself. Wait for it to be updated some more. I certainly will wait until I try playing this game again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a great game, just a thumbs down in its current PRE" alpha state (whatever the hell that means). It expands upon and adds a lot of elements Space Engineers should have had.  Planets have alien bases that are challenging to attack rewarding to pillage. Survival elements are fantastic with the need to gather food and keep a steady supply of oxygen. Base building and ship building is a lot of fun. Overall I've had more fun with this than Space Engineers.

Why the thumbs down? It's really frustrating to build something cool and lose it all because of bugs. And this is bound to happen to you. If you play this game and want to create a large ship or base with all kinds of interesting areas... just understand that at any point you can hit a really stupid bug that will wreck all your hard work. It's really frustring to dump 15 hours into a game and to lose everything you built to some stupid bug.

Play at your own risk. You'll have a blast until something stupid  happens (not IF... but WHEN) that ruins everything for you."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lots of little actions that take forever in other games (cough space engineers) go quickly in Empyrion, and there's a tech tree for obvious progression. The game has developed very quickly over a few months.

At this point, it needs more obvious endgame content, more interesting enemies, and some refining in certain areas (e.g., small ship turning and movement, map waypoints).

NEVER BASE YOUR OPINION ON REVIEWS WRITTEN BY LITTLE KIDS WITH 0.5HRS ON RECORD OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT WHICH HAPPENS A LOT NOW THAT THIS GAME IS FREE TO PLAY FOR THE WEEKEND.IF YOU DO THAT THEN GOOD LUCK FINDING A GOOD EARLY ACCESS GAME TO INVEST YOUR MONEY ON.

DEVELOPERS

What can I say about this devs...they are just awesome,updating the game at least once a week with a very nice update,(this week we had updates every single day).Best thing is that they are doing exactly what they told us they will do when this game launched for the first time.And their roadmap is fascinating…I will tell you one thing they plan to add in the future:infinite procedural galaxy with many unique planets, each planet with its own flora and fauna,(yeah like no mans sky=which basically single player ooops), and every server will be connected to each other and will represent a small part of this galaxy.Yeah I know that it sounds just empty words but based on what they told us this game will have in the first alpha version,(like 1 month ago…before that it was in pre alpha),they actually implemented every single thing they said.So I can say that they are trustworthy.Trustowrthy devs + game with potential = ♥♥♥♥ yeah

GAMEPLAY
Single Player:

First of all,Empyrion in this stage,(early alpha),has more content than any other EA game on steam.
Also don’t even thing trying multiplayer before learning the game in single player…you stand no chance.
So when you start a game you are clash landing in an unknown planet with some basic resources to begin your adventure.Generally what you do is Survive-Explore-Conquer...Although base on the story you are in a quest to find the planet Empyrion in the Andromeda galaxy cause this planet has everything people on Earth need to survive cause they are in some sort of a crisis.This planet is obviously not implemented yet.So first you are trying to survive against the hostile creatures and some high tech aliens that “rule” the planet.You search for food and resources then build a base and then build a small spaceship to get out of this planet and go to the nearest planets or moons you see and gather some rare resources that cannot be found in your planet.With these resources you can build a huge spaceship and a warp drive machine so you can travel to other planets that are very far away.Every planet is unique with its own flora and fauna.Trust me,building YOUR OWN spaceship and flying it out of your planets orbit to space and then entering an uknown planet or battling in space with aliens or other players is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome.Even if you are a bad builder you can make a ship right from the workshop which has tons.All that wont be that easy cause aliens will hunt and battle you both in planets and space.

Multiplayer:

Here things are a little different.In most of the servers you are landing on a pve planet and everyone on this planet is trying to make a spaceship and go to a pvp planet,(most planets are pvp),or space which is also pvp cause pve planets wipe very often.Now the best servers have concept too like the star wars server were you choose either to be republic or imperial or other star wars races,or the hws server where you choose to be a pirate or bounty hunter or trader and things like that.So in this servers you are trying with your race to destroy your rival race…you know planet and space battles with unique playerbuild  spaceships and big guns,all that boring stuff.Also most servers have usually have more planets than single player.

GRAPHICS

I know that for most of us graphics are important and I myself am a graphics enthusiast.Empyrion has nice graphics on high and 1080p (which is not even that demanding)…Not the best graphics but I like them and they keeping evolving fast so its all good.Trust me I have seen this game when it first launched and graphics were horrible.When this got into alpha though we got a big graphic improvement and now the planets are beautiful and they will be even better…cant wait .Also you don’t need to have a super computer to play this…I am mostly playing this from my 4years old laptop with a gt 540m graphics crad which is discusting and in most planets at medium settings I have about 30 fps and 40-60 fps on space.Many times though I play it from a stronger pc (not mine) so I can enjoy the nice graphics.

Community

Best community I have ever seen till now.Everyone is willing to help or just be friends and play together.

Cons

-Starting may not be that easy at your first time,although now if you press f1 it opens you a tutorial or should I say a whole encyclopedia about how to play even if you have lower IQ than a caterpie.
-Bugs.Like every other EA game Empyrion has bugs too.In single player they wont bother you at all cause they are few and not that game breaking.In multiplayer though you will experience more bugs and some rare ones may ♥♥♥♥ you off like losing your ship and that happens mainly cause people spawn pre-alpha ships from workshop that break the playfields,so never spawn pre-alpha blueprint and you wont lose your ship.Multiplayer needs some work but its playable dont worry.
-AI is pretty basic right now and especially the animals but they said they will change that
-I would prefer faster crafting
CONCLUSION

Empyrion may look like other survival games but it isn’t.It is in his own way unique,beautifull and super fun with friends.So don’t hesitate and support this game so it reaches its full potential.Thats how an early access game grows you know…by supporting it.Not waiting till it dies or till it even manages to release and then say “oh it isnt as good as I expected to be”.Thats the problem with EA games,yeah I know many developers only care about money and they take your money and go away forever but there are a few that don’t do that so do your research and if the devs seem trustworthy then take that small risk and support them.

After playing for 14 hours at the time of writing this review (6/10/15). I cannot currently reconmend this game in its state.

I do feel that this game could be great and if done right rival the popularity of space engineers and other survival games. I do really want to like this game and I do plan on trying to play this game at a later date and hopefully edit this review in time.

My experience has been completely bug ridden and save corrupting where I could not even build a base before the game either crashed to desktop or bugged out hard.  I've had save's seem to mesh" together and the locations of where I was in both save seem to combine on load resulting in some very deformed terrain. I've had save files corrupt so much that even after sending the data to the developer as per their request they couldnt even open it.
Some harvestable plants are incredibly easy to find as they glow when you shine a light on them. Cannon and Gatling drone's getting stuck and becoming invincible (Fixed with new patch)

5/5/16

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Have been playing this game for several patches. The Patches have had thier ups and downs but overall the game is better now than when i started.
You begin crash landed on an alien planet with minimal resources. you may start on one of two planets, Omicron being the harder to begin on as it has no breatheable atmosphere. Not only is the environment hostile but there are also hostile AI Aliens to contend with. You will have to forage or grow food, gather resources all the while defending yourself from aliens and Hostile flora and or fauna.
There are multiple planets in the starting solar system along with alien bases, crashed starships and asteroid belts to explore. You may build hover vehicles, small spaceships and capital vessels or starships. there are no places to go with a starship at the moment but the goal is a procedurally generated galaxy. Patches and updates are frequent and you will find yourself often on the ragged edge of survival. The game as it sits is worth the price of admission and of all the early access games i have played recently, this one seems the most likely to reach its goals, and the goals seem to be worthwhile.
As far as survival games go this is definitely a better one. it is also a fairly competent building game. There are playable multiplayer servers although they are in the very early stages and are very wild wild west at the moment. The alien presence on planets scales upwards with the value of the resources usually and the various types of bases also ramp up in effectiveness and difficulty. The aliens will try and take out your vehicles and bases whether you are in them or not, although at later stages they are little threat if you are actively defending anything.
You will find this game challenging at the beginning and less so as you progress, Although they are still patching and improving so that it is likely to get nothing but better and better as it advances towards completion. There is a rather pointless type of character leveling where you must gain experience to get research points to  unlock better parts and machinery but currently you will pretty much level up faster than you will actually require the advances just by doing what you must to survive. Overall this is the best early access game of its type i have played. Well worth the price.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun little game.  It is a minecraft-like game where you are dumped on a hostile planet and have to survive.  You have to keep food and (if you're on a planet without breathable atmosphere) oxygen supplied, and can mine different ores in order to make stuff.  You start out in an escape pod, a few rations, and a pistol... but you can build a base with automated turrets to defend yourself, make better weapons, and even make vehicles.

On vehicles:  We're talking about things as small as a simple buggy to get around and as large as a capital ship able to fly through space and get to other planets.  That is one of the things that makes this game really interesting is that, unlike games like minecraft, the game doesn't really end" once you've conquored your immediate environment.  You set out into space and land yourself on a (much) more hostile planet if you want.

It is still in Alpha when I'm writing this
date: so it could fizzle out and amount to nothing... but so far it has been a fun little game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best sandbox games since Dayz legacy, every update is getting better. Devs are not plebs, they are fixing bugs and adding content at the same time without breaking the game as many other developers do. This game will be massive, the player base is growing quickly.

Awesome asepts of the game:
Amazing open sandbox with amazing concepts
-Building mechanics are rock solid
-Build and design your hover vessel, small vessel (flying) , huge capital vessels and bases anywhere and any way you like
-Fly out of the atmosphere and into space to mine or to fly to other planets or moons
-Mining, farming, raiding bases, fighting npc and drones
-Really massive planets to roam
-Solid crafting system

Things I hope to see or upgraded:
-Tons more planets
-More mobs, npcs and drones - with more health
-More ores (even though there are a lot)
-Things to bring people together for pvp battles eg. server events like loot spawns

Fantastic game super bargin, cant wait to see where it goes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Something about this game appeals to me. I'm not normally a big fan of the open-world-survival-with-crafting-elements genre and tend to shy away from Early Access - but seeing a prominent youtuber play this, the potential clearly on offer made me buy it.

I've just finished my second permadeath survival play; 5 and a half hours in, I got one-shot killed from an unexpected place whilst attempting a sneaky landing near a spoilery location - destroyed my cockpit but left the rest of my craft intact.

If the developer manages to make these ships and encounters random so that there's no notion of whether you're safe or not from prior experience, this could be one of the best games in this genre. As it stands, the grind to get the escape pod airborne again won't be fun next time.

10/10 will die in one shot again.
